meanings.definition: Cancel or reverse the effects or results of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to undo the mistake I made on my homework.
meanings.sent2: She quickly pressed Ctrl+Z to undo her last action on the computer.
meanings.sent3: Trying to undo a knot without looking is like solving a puzzle blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: His apology couldn't undo the hurtful words he had said.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand, and the spell was undone before our eyes.

meanings.definition: Cause to be in a state of disarray or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous puppy managed to undo all the neatly stacked books.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news completely undid her carefully laid plans.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's actions were sure to undo the calm atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise from the construction site undid any chance of a peaceful nap.
meanings.sent5: The spilled paint quickly undid the hours of meticulous work.

meanings.sent1: Please undo the knot in this rope so we can use it again.
meanings.sent2: She carefully undid the ribbon on the gift to reveal what was inside.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to undo the tangled mess of shoelaces on his own.
meanings.sent4: The warm water helped to undo the tight muscles after a long day of work.
meanings.sent5: The key finally fit into the lock, allowing it to undo and open the door.
